org.jetel.graph

Class TransformationGraphAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.graph.TransformationGraphAnalyzer

  • public class TransformationGraphAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that analyzes relations between Nodes and Edges of the Transformation Graph
    Since:
    April 2, 2002
    See Also:
    OtherClasses

    • Constructor Detail

      • TransformationGraphAnalyzer

        public TransformationGraphAnalyzer()

    • Method Detail

      • analyseGraph

        public static void analyseGraph(TransformationGraph graph,
                GraphRuntimeContext runtimeContext,
                boolean propagateMetadata)
        Several pre-execution steps is performed in this graph analysis. - disable nodes are removed from graph - subgraph related updates are performed - automatic metadata propagation is performed - correct edge types are detected

      • analyseSubgraph

        public static void analyseSubgraph(TransformationGraph graph,
                   boolean removeDebugNodes,
                   boolean layoutChecking)
        Checks subgraph layout and removes all components before SubgraphInput and after SubgraphOutput.

      • analyseEdgeTypes

        public static void analyseEdgeTypes(TransformationGraph graph,
                    GraphRuntimeContext runtimeContext)
        Detects suitable type of edges for the given graph. Edge types are preset directly to the graph instance.

      • disableNodesInPhases

        public static void disableNodesInPhases(TransformationGraph graph)
                                 throws GraphConfigurationException
        Apply disabled property of node to graph. Called in graph initial phase.
        Throws:
        GraphConfigurationException

      • findPrecedentNodes

        public static java.util.List<Node> findPrecedentNodes(Node node,
                                      java.util.Collection<Node> reflectedNodes)
        Parameters:
        node -
        reflectedNodes - reflected set of nodes, typically nodes in phase; the resulted nodes will be only from this set of nodes
        Returns:
        list of all precedent nodes for given node

      • findPrecedentNodesRecursive

        public static java.util.List<Node> findPrecedentNodesRecursive(Node rootComponent,
                                               java.util.Collection<Node> reflectedNodes)
        Finds all components which precede given root component. Recursive version of findPrecedentNodes(Node, Collection) method.

      • findFollowingNodes

        public static java.util.List<Node> findFollowingNodes(Node node,
                                      java.util.Collection<Node> reflectedNodes)
        Parameters:
        node -
        reflectedNodes - reflected set of nodes, typically nodes in phase; the resulted nodes will be only from this set of nodes
        Returns:
        list of all following nodes for given node

      • findFollowingNodesRecursive

        public static java.util.List<Node> findFollowingNodesRecursive(Node rootComponent,
                                               java.util.Collection<Node> reflectedNodes)
        Finds all components which follow given root component. Recursive version of findFollowingNodes(Node, Collection) method.

      • nodesTopologicalSorting

        public static java.util.List<Node> nodesTopologicalSorting(java.util.List<Node> givenNodes)
        Components topological sorting based on Kahn algorithm. This algorithm is used for user friendly nodes visualisation and for single thread graph execution, see SingleThreadWatchDog.
        Parameters:
        givenNodes - scope in which the topological sorting is performed - only mentioned components are considered
        Returns:
        given nodes in topological order
